name: Premier Inn London Southwark - Tate Modern

reviews.text: Great location, it has everything you need. The bar is nice, the food and beer is good, next door is a Tesco express and a cash point.
reviews.title: First rate

reviews.text: The only thing missing is a car park, but there is on road parking free after 6.30pm if you can judge it right.
reviews.title: Family trip.Sue Steve Ben James Anne and David.
Excellent service and understanding
reviews.text: Staff are great and this hotel sets the standard for quality value for money in London.

we were four adults and two children.family and double rooms which were spotless and very quiet. staff were very pleasant and helpful.we would recommend this hotel to anyone .we ate in the hotel both evenings and the breakfast were excellant.we were also able to leave our luggage for a while after checkout enabling us to sightsee as our train home was in the evening.Hotel position great for lots of good places to visit.
reviews.title: group trip to London
Great hotel
reviews.text: We gave the Premier Inn Southwark Tate Modern a real headache when we double booked our recent stay, to attend a family wedding. On top of that, we had booked the wrong Premier Inn; we needed to stay at the Premier Inn Borough Market.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a quiet location but only minutes from the buzz of this fabulous city! There are many cafés, bars and restaurants nearby and Southwark tube/ Waterloo East is an easy 5 minutes walk. Tate Modern and the Thames is also a 5 minute stroll from the hotel and from there you can walk along the river in either direction to see many of the sites that London is famous for. The rooms at this Premier Inn are a good size- probably 20sqm- and are very clean. There is a Tesco Express next door which was very convenient. The staff made this hotel a great place to stay- they were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: Premier Inn keep on doing it and I now stay regularly both for business and pleasure.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff!! great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The training must be first class as the staff never disappoint.
reviews.title: What lovely staff

reviews.text: From arrival to departure including breakfast everything was faultless and room 703 has a great view of the Shard.
reviews.title: Good location, decent hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is well located for the South bank and there are good food and watering holes in walking distance.
reviews.title: Family trip to London

reviews.text: Great value hotel in Central London. Short distance from tube and river. Clean family room, very welcoming and friendly staff from the moment we arrived. Breakfast was good and bar area was relaxing. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Everything you expect

reviews.text: this hotel is one of the newest in London and only booked this because I couldn't get booked into my usual one at county court,its too far out of the way of all main sights in London and the breakfast area is far too small for the size,we had to queue to wait for a table for breakfast.
reviews.title: premier inn tate modern

reviews.text: As everywhere in London here too the service was very friendly. Except one lady (Elvira) from the morning buffet who was rather rude and unpolite. Asking for chocolatpasta for the childres her ansewer "If you want chocopasta you have to go to a five star hotel", a no sorry would have been enough. It was strange compazred to all the rest of the staff. The rooms were clean, the breakfast buffet was fine, good coffee... My service would have been excellent without the remarks
reviews.title: It was OK for London, it is an expensive city of course

reviews.text: My family and I spent a long week-end in London for Halloween and were very satisfied with the Hotel accomodation. We found the quality/cost rate favourable: rooms were comfortable and clean with possibility to have a proper 3 bed room, the hotel location was convenient, in walking distance to the London Bridge station with connections to Gatwick airport. Overall the athmosphere was warm and the staff very professional.
reviews.title: Halloween in London

reviews.text: We paid for breakfast, which was a good choice with angry children, even if one morning it took us 15 min to be seated and the room was quite crowdy with small tables for 5 people, but the friendliness of the waiters made them forgiven.
reviews.title: great long week end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night whilst at a Banquet at the Guildhall, so didn't dine. It is tucked away, but convenient, with taxis and buses available on the main road 2 minutes away, although we were lucky enough to get a taxi on the side street right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Plain but convenient

reviews.text: It is usual standard Premier Inn, plain but clean. The check-in was so efficient - you can do this in advance - and the staff super helpful and friendly, both at reception and in the restaurant at breakfast. The price is much more than you would pay at a Premier Inn normally, but you are just South of the river in Central London, so nothing is going to be cheap - the best of all the ones we researched before booking.
reviews.title: A great weekend
The staff are a real credit to Premier
reviews.text: My wife and daughter stayed at this premier inn for easy access to central London for my wife's 50th birthday. We were going to Ronnnie Scott's in Soho and the Ritz Hotel both around 3 miles from the hotel. Premier Inn staff booked our taxi's and called us when they arrived and were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The hotel is spotlessly clean as were the two rooms we booked. The Premier Inn Southwark (Tate modern) is far enough outside the city to allow a quiet undisturbed night's sleep but near enough for easy access. Southwark underground is within easy walking distance and one stop from London Waterloo main line. Everything about this hotel is perfect for visiting London and would recommend to anyone.
For the cost and location, close to the Globe and the Tate Modern, this hotel cannot be beaten.
reviews.title: Great staff, comfortable stay

reviews.text: What makes it so good, though, are the friendly and enthusiastic young staff members. What a credit they are to their employers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

aka: Premier Inn London Southwark - Tate Modern England
